mn117:7.1: And what is right view that is noble, undefiled, transcendent, a factor of the path?

mn117:15.1: In this context, right view comes first.

mn117:17.2: This exposition of the teaching on the Great Forty has been rolled forth. And it cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.
mn117:18.1: If any ascetic or brahmin imagines they can criticize and reject the exposition of the teaching on the Great Forty, they deserve rebuke and criticism on ten legitimate grounds in the present life.
